title: Australia's most expensive home sold for $140m
text:
All three towers in One Sydney Harbour project - the other two are 60 storeys and 30 storeys respectively - have been designed by Pritzker Prize-winning architect Renzo Piano.

The final of the three towers received planning approval earlier this month.

Already more than $1 billion in sales and commitments have been

achieved across the project, with many of the buyers local customers.

“The sale of the penthouse at One Sydney Harbour is a paradigm shift for the

Australian property market with an apartment claiming the title of Australia’s most valuable residential property for the first time, a title historically reserved for significant houses," said Kylie Rampa, Lendlease's chief executive for property.

The penthouse is the most expensive sold in Australia.

“The record-breaking penthouse sale is confirmation that the Barangaroo South precinct is a world-leading location where people aspire to live, work and visit.

“Demand for residences throughout the tower has been extremely high, attracting strong local and global interest.

“A key differentiator for the One Sydney Harbour towers is that we’ve curated the entire precinct surrounding it, which ensures everything works together, complements each other and is considered holistically.”

Advertisement

The penthouse has been designed as a single residence. That allows the

additional third floor – which forms part of the overall home – to function as a separate residence.

The the three residential towers of Lendlease's One Sydney Harbour development at Barangaroo.

The total home includes nine-bedrooms, with more than 1,600 square metres of living space with eight-metre-high ceilings.

It features a roof-top pool, spa and gymnasium, as well as a master bedroom that is bigger than most homes.

A further seven whole floor apartments have been sold already, said Lendlease's global sales head Ben Christie.

"There is significant depth in the super luxury apartment market in Australia.

“With such strong interest to date, we are confident that the balance of the building will be highly sought after in the coming weeks."
description: The off-the-plan sale of the top three floors of the tallest tower at Lendlease's One Sydney Harbour project sets a record for the most expensive residence in Australia.
